      • getObjectFromPacket

        public static byte[] getObjectFromPacket(byte[] data)
        Takes the bytes of an object's byte array, doesn't include the checksum bytes, finds the size of the object, and returns the object in an array of bytes.
        Parameters:
        data - The object array sent from the packet.
        Returns:
        The object in a byte array.

      • getChecksumFromPacket

        public static java.lang.String getChecksumFromPacket(byte[] data)
        Gets the first 10 bytes of the data, which is the checksum, and converts it to a string.
        Parameters:
        data - The packet sent from the server.
        Returns:
        The checksum in a string.

      • getChecksumOfObject

        public static java.lang.String getChecksumOfObject(byte[] data)
        Takes the byte array of an object and gets the checksum from it.
        Parameters:
        data - The object's byte array.
        Returns:
        The checksum.

      • getByteArray

        public static byte[] getByteArray(IProtocol protocol,
                  java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream stream)
        Gets the byte array of the object, the checksum of the object, and combines them into an array of bytes. The first 10 bytes are the checksum and the remaining bytes are the object.
        Parameters:
        stream - The object's byte stream to get the byte array.
        object - The object being sent.
        Returns:
        The byte array with the size of it being Config.PACKET_BUFFER_SIZE

      • getCompressedByteArray

        public static byte[] getCompressedByteArray(IProtocol protocol,
                            java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream stream)
        Gets the byte array of the object, the checksum of the object, and combines them into an array of bytes. The first 10 bytes are the checksum and the remaining bytes are the object.
        Parameters:
        stream - The object's byte stream to get the byte array.
        object - The object being sent.
        Returns:
        The byte array with the size of it being the byte length of the object and checksum.
